column_a:
commodity /ˈkɒmədɪtjuː/
Examples: Crude oil is one of the most traded commodities globally. The local market provides various agricultural products as commodities.
column_b:
Part of Speech: noun
Definition: A raw material or primary product held by a trader for the purpose of resale, often in bulk and subject to price fluctuations; any valuable thing that can be bought or sold.
Synonyms: good, product, raw material
Antonyms: service, luxury item

column_a:
snub [ˈsnʌb]
Examples: 'I felt snubbed when I waited for hours and nobody showed up'; 'He thought his ex-girlfriend had forgotten about him, but it was just a simple case of being misunderstood.'
column_b:
Part of Speech: verb, noun
Definition: 'Snub' as a verb means to ignore or treat with contempt; 'snub' as a noun refers to an act of ignoring someone.
Synonyms: reject; ignore; scorn
Antonyms: acknowledge; receive
